subclass.name: Way of the Sacred Body
subclassFeatures: Way of the Sacred Body|Monk|PHB|Sacred Body|BITCSubclasses|3|BITCSubclasses

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Spore
entries: Barbarians draw power from many sources; anger, fanaticism, their ancestors. Some draw supernatural strength from substances they process and prepare, both to alter their minds as well as give them powerful advantages in battle. To use such things does not come without risk, and the barbarians of the Path of the Spore hone their bodies and build their tolerances for their entire life in order to inhale the toxic and mind{@homebrew -}bending spores of cultivated underground mushrooms. These spores are prepared as part of a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Black Rotter
entries: You take {@damage 6d6} poison damage immediately that cannot be reduced in any way. If this damage should reduce your hit points to 0, you do not fall {@condition unconscious}, but instead you are reduced to {@homebrew one Hit Point|1hp} and your melee {@homebrew weapon} attacks gain an additional {@damage 6d6} damage. If you are not reduced to {@homebrew zero Hit Points|0hp}, you instead only gain a bonus of {@damage 2d6} damage to {@homebrew your|their} melee {@homebrew weapon} attacks. This bonus ends either once the {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|PHB|1|PHB} ends, or if you regain at least 10 hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Tube
entries: You are coated with an adhesive substance. You gain a climbing speed equal to your movement speed. When you hit a creature with an unarmed attack, their movement speed is reduced by 10 ft. until the end of their next turn as they become coated with the sticky substance. A target hit by an attack has disadvantage on {@skill acrobatics} checks until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Koboldcap
entries: You regain {@dice 8d6} hit points. If you are restored to full hit points by this, you are {@condition poisoned} until the end of the {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|PHB|1|PHB}, regardless of whether you are immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition or not.

subclassFeature.name: Red Belch
entries: You acquire a breath weapon for the duration of the {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|PHB|1|PHB} that can be used as a bonus action during your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|PHB|1|PHB} a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier. When you use your breath weapon, each creature in a 15 ft. line must make a {@homebrew Dexterity|DEX} saving throw. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: Spore Inhalation
entries: When you choose this path at 3rd level, you begin to inhale powerful mushroom spores that have been treated and prepared in order to go into a rage. You gain proficiency with {@item poisoner's kit|PHB|poisoner's kits}. Additionally, when you take the {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|PHB|1|PHB} bonus action, you choose a type of spore to inhale; each one has a different effect. This effect lasts until the end of your rage.

subclassFeature.name: Venom Stalk
entries: The first character to hit you on a turn with a melee attack{@homebrew |s} must take a {@dc 12} Constitution save or suffer {@damage 2d4} poison damage, or half as much on a successful save.

subclassFeature.name: Whimsical Cap
entries: You no longer provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}, and gain 15 ft. to your movement speed. {@homebrew Implemented as walking speed only in Foundry, needs clarification.}

subclassFeature.name: Frenzied Abuse
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can switch between different spores quickly. As an action, you can switch from one spore effect to another without ending your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|PHB|1|PHB}. When you do this, you take {@damage 1d6} poison damage that cannot be reduced in any way, and you gain 10 temporary hitpoints that disappear at the start of your next turn. For each subsequent use of this ability during a single {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|PHB|1|PHB}, you take an additional {@damage 1d6} damage.

subclassFeature.name: Poison Blood
entries: At 10th level, your blood becomes so toxic that it has the capacity to harm others who come in contact with it. When taking over 10 damage in melee whilst raging, as a reaction you can cause every creature within 5 ft. to {@homebrew make|take} a constitution save. The DC is equal to 8 + your proficiency modifier + your constitution modifier. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.
When you are reduced to 0 hit points, the gasses in your body escape and cause {@damage 2d12} acid damage to all creatures within 20 ft. of you, excluding yourself.

activation.condition: When you take more than 10 damage whilst raging

subclassFeature.name: Mix and Match
entries: At level 14, when you enter a {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|PHB|1|PHB}, you are now able to combine two different spore effects. When you enter a {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|PHB|1|PHB}, choose two spore types rather than one. When using the {@subclassFeature Frenzied Abuse|Barbarian|PHB|Spore|BITCSubclasses|6|BITCSubclasses} feature, you can only change one of the effects at a time.

subclassFeature.name: College of Colours
entries: Performance is not limited solely to the creation of music, but also the display of art and visual beauty. Bards that adhere to the college of Colours can capture those that witness them in a dazzling whirlwind of beauty. These bards are able to weave magic into colours and pigments, provoking a severe emotional reaction in any who witness them. This can be both inspiring and debilitating, and those that underestimate the bard trained in such arts may find themselves lost in horrifying hues, or entranced by shifting patterns.
The images created by the bard of the College of Colours blur the lines between real and unreal.

subclassFeature.name: Disorienting Flicker
entries: Until the end of your next turn, a creature which you can see within 30 ft. of your Imbued image suffers a penalty to their attack rolls and ability checks equal to your charisma modifier. The Imbued Image then disappears.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Explosion
entries: Every creature within 20ft. of the imbued image take damage equal to your bardic inspiration die + your Charisma Modifier. The damage type can be either fire, cold, poison, lightning, or thunder damage. The Imbued Image then disappears.

parts: fire, cold, poison, lightning, or thunder

subclassFeature.name: Healing Burst
entries: A creature of your choosing within 60 ft. of the Imbued Image regains hit points equal to your bardic inspiration die + your Charisma Modifier. The Imbued Image then disappears.

subclassFeature.name: Warping Shimmer
entries: You or a willing creature within 30 ft. of you that you can see teleports into the space of the Imbued Image. The creature that teleports in this way then gains a number of temporary hit points equal to a roll on your bardic inspiration die. The imbued image then disappears.

subclassFeature.name: Artistic Genius
entries: At 3rd level, if you do not already have proficiency in {@item painter's supplies|PHB}, you gain proficiency in {@item painter's supplies|PHB}, and can use them as a spellcasting focus for your spells. You also add the spell {@spell Color Spray} to your known spells list. This does not count towards your maximum number of known spells.

As a bonus action, you can paint an Imbued Image, which appears as a hovering image that fits within a 5ft cube within 5 ft. of you when you create it. Creating an Imbued Image costs a {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|PHB|1} die.
The image lasts for one minute. As long as it persists, you can cast any spell with a range other than self as if the spell originated from the image.
As a bonus action on any subsequent turn, you can activate the Imbued Image in one of four ways.

subclassFeature.name: Hard Paint Creation
entries: At 6th level, as an action, you can create a shape or item using your paints. You can create a shape, like a cube, a square, or staircase in a 10ft cube within a space you can see within 30 ft. of you. This shape can either be opaque or transparent.

This Hard Paint Creation can be interacted with, and has 10 hit points and an AC of 10. These items are static, have no weight, and cannot be moved, but can be destroyed. If it is reduced to 0 hit points it disappears. This creation lasts until the end of your next turn.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier. You regain all expended uses after a long rest.
At level 14, your Hard Paint Creations have 20 hit points and can fill a space in a 15 ft. cube.

subclassFeature.name: Visual Alteration
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to alter your appearance as an action, as if you cast the {@spell Disguise Self} spell. To use this ability you must have your {@item painter's supplies|PHB} in hand. You can use this ability a number of times {@homebrew per long rest} equal to your proficiency bonus. This visual change lasts indefinitely until you end it as a free action.

subclassFeature.name: Mesmerising Images
entries: At 14th level, your Imbued Images become more powerful. As an action, you can expend a bardic inspiration die to cause an imbued image to perform one of the following actions:

subclassFeature.name: Horrifying Vision
entries: A creature you can see within 30 ft. of the Imbued Image must succeed a Wisdom Save or become {@condition frightened} of you. The creature must on its turn use its movement to move as far away from you as possible, avoiding obviously dangerous terrain, and can only use its action to {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage}. The creature can repeat the save on the end of its subsequent turns. The effect will end after 1 minute. The imbued image then disappears.

subclassFeature.name: Hue Shift
entries: Until the beginning of your next turn, you can alter the form damage takes. If a creature takes fire, cold, lightning, acid, or poison damage within 30 ft. of the imbued image, you can change the damage type to a different damage type from that same list, and in addition either reduce or increase the damage by a certain amount; this amount is equal to your bardic inspiration die. The imbued image then disappears.

parts: fire, cold, lightning, acid, or poison

subclassFeature.name: Ink Cloud
entries: A cloud of darkness emanates from the Imbued Image, as if the spell {@spell Darkness} had been cast centered on the Imbued Image{@homebrew , the imbued image then disappears}. This effect lasts for one minute. {@homebrew |The imbued image then disappears.}

subclassFeature.name: Paralyzing Undulation
entries: A creature you can see within 30 ft. of the Imbued Image must succeed a Charisma Save against your spell save DC or become {@condition paralyzed} until the end of your next turn. The imbued image then disappears.

subclassFeature.name: Reason Domain
entries: The scientific method; divine entities of philosophy and wisdom; logic and discourse...these things are of the domain of rationality. The Reason domain may not even have gods per se, but forces of logic and consequence that suffuse every action and reaction in the known universe.

Gods of this domain are associated with both wisdom, learning, and enlightened thought, as wisdom and intelligence often accompany rational thought. The relationship between a cleric and a god of reason may be transactional or even paradoxical, yet understanding the divine nature of a cleric of the Reason Domain's god and contemplating it within the world they inhabit is a core aspect of their power and creed. Gods of this domain may include {@deity Athena|Greek|PHB}, Saraswati, or {@deity Oghma|Celtic|PHB}. On Gol, this domain is best inhabited by {@deity The Great Architect|Gol|BloodInTheCompany} deity.

subclassFeature.name: Initiate of Knowledge
entries: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain proficiency in the History skill if you were not already proficient in it.

subclassFeature.name: Reason Domain Spells
entries: At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared. They do not count towards your limit.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Enforce Logic
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to abjure chaotic creatures.

As an action, you present your {@item holy symbol|PHB}, and one chaotic aligned creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC, provided the creature can see or hear you. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly end its move in a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the {@action Dash} action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, then the creature can use the {@action Dodge} action.

After you reach 5th level, when a creature fails its saving throw against your Enforce Logic feature, the creature becomes {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute if its challenge rating is at or below a certain threshold, as shown below.

subclassFeature.name: Equivalent Exchange
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you target a creature with a single-target spell of 1st level or higher, you can end one spell of your choice on that creature. The level of the spell you end must be equal to or lower than the level of the spell cast.

subclassFeature.name: Abjure the Arcane
entries: At 8th level, you gain advantage on all saving throws made against spells.

subclassFeature.name: Supreme Reason
entries: At 17th level, when a creature fails a saving throw from a spell you cast, you can force the creature to take an action of your choosing and then move up to their movement speed in a direction you choose. You can only cause one creature to take this action per turn. The creature will not move into obviously dangerous terrain, such as fire.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Absurd
entries: Druids who are a member of the Circle of Absurd originate from regions and places touched by truly eldritch and incomprehensible forces; places where the laws of reality are altered in ways few can comprehend. The magic harnessed by these druids alters the very constants of the world. Druids from this circle aim not just to protect these pockets of absurdity, but also to keep the realms of reality safe from their mayhem.

subclassFeature.name: Bend Reality
entries: At 2nd level, you become imbued with reality-warping powers. You have a pool of Warp magic represented by a number of {@dice d6|d6s} equal to your Wisdom modifier.

As a reaction, when you see a creature within 60 ft. of you make an ability check, saving throw, or attack roll, you can choose to add or subtract one of your Warp Die from the roll. You can do this after the roll is made but before the results are announced. When you use this ability, roll on the following table.

subclassFeature.name: Unnatural Alteration
entries: At 6th level, you can use your {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|PHB|2} to alter the forms of those around you. By expending a use of your {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|PHB|2}, you can choose a willing creature you touch other than yourself, and roll on the following table. The creature will have the following effect for the next ten minutes:

subclassFeature.name: Siphoning Wild Shape
entries: At 10th level, when you use your druid {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|PHB|2} feature to transform into a creature, the damage type of your attacks is changed to force. Additionally, when you deal damage, once per turn you can grant a creature you can see other than yourself within 30ft temporary hit points equal to your proficiency modifier. These hit points last until the start of your next turn.

activation.condition: When you deal damage while in Wild Shape

subclassFeature.name: Dimensional Wild Shape
entries: At 14th level, your {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|PHB|2|PHB|Wild Shapes} begin to draw from the {@homebrew myriad|myrial} universes you have been in contact with. You are no longer restricted to only beasts when selecting a form to {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|PHB|2} into. You may choose any creature that is not undead or humanoid to use as your {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|PHB|2}, so long as it is still of the appropriate CR. You must have seen the creature at least once (or otherwise have strong familiarity with it) in order to {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|PHB|2} into it.

subclassFeature.name: Destiny Warrior
entries: Destiny is a cosmic force like any other, and for those attuned to the will of the cosmos can learn to adapt to the tides of fate. To be a Destiny Warrior, it is a balancing act of submitting to forces beyond your control but also to demand {@homebrew obeisance|obeissance} from the universe itself, and to allow your ego to impress itself upon causality itself. To achieve this can sometimes mean being the subject of prophecy, witnessing the changing of ages or being displaced in terms of time and space. To be a Destiny Warrior is a lonesome thing, but for those who walk this path there is often no choice in the matter.

Destiny Warriors are often highly individualistic and {@homebrew independent|independant}, as they are able to overcome obstacles alone that would certainly kill a normal mortal. They can range from resigned to a fate they may not understand or have control over, to highly egotistical individuals who believe themselves invincible.

subclassFeature.name: Force of Ego
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to use the energy of your personality itself to affect your body. You use your Charisma modifier, instead of Constitution, for the purposes of hit point calculation (minimum of {@homebrew 1|+1}).

subclassFeature.name: Servant of Destiny
entries: At 3rd level, you are able to enter a trance in which you attune with the forces of destiny that guide you, pushing to perform superhuman feats. When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you may sacrifice one of your attack rolls to enter a destiny trance. Your weapon attacks now score a critical hit on a roll of an 18, 19, or 20. In addition, when you score a critical hit, instead of rolling each damage dice twice, you roll damage as normal and an additional effect will occur. Roll on the following table ({@dice d8}) to determine what happens:

If you take damage equal {@homebrew to} or greater {@homebrew than|to} your character level, you must pass a Charisma Save, the DC of which equals half the damage taken. On a failed save, you end your trance. The trance may also end if you are reduced to 0 hit points or {@homebrew are} {@condition incapacitated}. Otherwise, the trance lasts an hour. You are able to enter a trance a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier, and you regain all expended uses after a long rest.

activation.condition: When you take the Attack action on your turn

subclassFeature.name: Duel of Fate
entries: Once you reach 7th level, you can issue a challenge to a creature within 60ft as a bonus action. For the next minute, the creature has disadvantage on attacks against creatures other than you unless it passes a Charisma saving throw. The creature is able to repeat the save at the end of each of its subsequent turns. The DC for this save equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your charisma modifier. The creature also cannot willingly move away from you unless forced. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier. All uses are returned following a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of Fate
entries: Upon reaching 10th level you begin to truly walk along your {@homebrew prophesied|prophesised} path, and become more resilient to obstacles that would otherwise kill you. When you take damage that would reduce you to 0 hit points or kill you, you are instead reduced to 1 hit point. You can benefit from this ability once per short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Destined Victory
entries: Upon reaching 15th level, the target of your {@subclassFeature Duel of Fate|Fighter|PHB|Destiny|BITCSubclasses|7} feature lends you power. When you finish your turn within 15 feet of the target of your {@subclassFeature Duel of Fate|Fighter|PHB|Destiny|BITCSubclasses|7} feature, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to 5 + your Charisma modifier if you have no more than half of your hit points left. You don't gain this benefit if you have 0 hit points.

activation.condition: When you finish your turn within 15 feet of the target of your Duel of Fate feature, if you have no more than half of your hit points left.

subclassFeature.name: Champion of Fate
entries: At 18th level, you become a nigh-invincible champion. Upon activating your Avatar of Fate feature, instead of being reduced to 1 hit point, you instead are returned to half of your maximum hit points. In addition, you gain resistance to piercing, slashing, and bludgeoning damage until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Sacred Body
entries: Religious orders, cults, and zealous organisations and groups do not solely employ acolytes and priests; they also attract a class of individual so dedicated that they turn their very bodies towards service. Their flesh is an extension of their cult's will, and whether through flagellation or discipline they become weapons to their cause or master.
There are many cults both dark and benign that may attract such people, and the devotion they display can cause even blessed clerics tremble before their absolute resolve.

subclassFeature.name: Power through Pain
entries: At level 3 you can, at the start of your turn, choose to take bludgeoning damage equal to one roll of your martial arts die in exchange for gaining a ki point. This damage cannot be reduced in any way. Additionally, if you use {@classFeature Flurry of Blows|Monk|PHB|2|PHB} before the end of your turn, you do additional damage on each additional strike equal to the damage taken. The damage you take at the beginning of your turn cannot be reduced in any way.

subclassFeature.name: Resolve of Near Death
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to, upon making a death saving throw, expend a number of ki points to, rather than roll, gain a number of successful death saves (up to a total of 3) equal to the number of ki points spent.

subclassFeature.name: Hardened Body
entries: At 6th level you can spend 2 ki points to gain a temporary bonus to Constitution, Dexterity, or Strength. The bonus is equal to +2, and lasts for one hour. This bonus cannot allow you to increase your score beyond 20. You may only have one bonus granted by this feature active at a time. You can dismiss the bonus as a free action on your turn.
At 17th level, you can spend 4 ki points to gain a temporary bonus equal to +4, and can increase an attribute beyond 20, up to 24.

If you use either {@classFeature Patient Defense|Monk|PHB|2|PHB} or {@classFeature Step of the Wind|Monk|PHB|2|PHB} whilst this feature is active, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier that remains until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Exalted Inspiration
entries: When you reach 11th level, you can inspire those around you to push past their limits. When you use either {@classFeature Flurry of Blows|Monk|PHB|2|PHB}, {@classFeature Patient Defense|Monk|PHB|2|PHB} or {@classFeature Step of the Wind|Monk|PHB|2|PHB}, you can spend an additional ki point to grant a number of creatures up to your Wisdom modifier that you can see temporary hit points equal to a roll of your martial arts die.

subclassFeature.name: Sacred Act
entries: At 17th level, before the end of your turn if you are not {@condition incapacitated}, you can expend 6 ki points to move up to your full movement speed, and perform an additional action and bonus action. You can only use this ability once per round. Any attack rolls {@homebrew |using} taken as part of the additional action and bonus action have advantage.
At the start of your next turn, you take poison damage equal to your monk level as the strain rebounds and harms your body. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Hardened Body
entries: At 17th level, you can spend 4 ki points to gain a temporary bonus equal to +4, and can increase an attribute beyond 20, up to 24.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Breath
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to strike with elemental power. As a bonus action, you can breathe in a 15 foot line. All creatures hit by this breath attack must succeed a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take damage equal to a number of {@dice d6}. The number of {@dice d6} rolled equals your proficiency modifier. The damage type is determined by the type of dragon your paladin is emulating. On a successful save, the damage is halved.
The length of the line increases to 30 feet at 15th level, and to 60 feet at 20th level.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Presence
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to exude the fearsome presence of dragons. As an action, you force each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw {@homebrew against your spell save DC}. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Emulation
entries: At 1st level, you choose one type of dragon to emulate. The damage type associated with each dragon is used by features you gain later.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Dragons
entries: The Oath of Dragons aligns the mind and body of the paladin with one of the most powerful creatures in existence. Many of these paladins may have draconic ancestry themselves, or aspire to become closer to these idealised creatures. Whilst they may vary wildly in terms of their individual personalities, they have a strict approach to the gaining and use of power, as for them it is power and might that defines the great dragon.

To take up the Oath of Dragons is to aspire to be greater than you are, to harness the wants and desires in your own heart and turn them towards something magnificent, be it a bright future or a tenebrous power.

An Oath of Dragons paladin might be a heroic guardian in the spirit of the noble silver dragons, or a brutal tyrant modelled after the despotic red dragons. By aligning themselves with dragons, the paladin gradually gains, or awakens, draconic features themselves.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Dragon
entries: The oath of the dragon focusses on the mindset of the dragon, putting a strong emphasis on power and supremacy.

entries.name: Power
entries: Your will is dependent on your ability to enact it.

entries.name: Self-Determination
entries: You are what you make yourself into. Do not let others dictate who you are.

entries.name: Dominate
entries: The weak must be guided by a strong hand. You must wield your strength to rule as you see fit.

entries.name: Patience
entries: Decisions must be considered in decades and centuries, not seconds and minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Affinity
entries: Starting at 7th level, you gain resistance to the damage type determined by your emulated dragon type. At 18th level, all friendly creatures of your choice within 30 feet also gain this resistance while you are not {@condition incapacitated}.
In addition, whenever you deal damage of the type determined by your emulated dragon type, you may add your Charisma modifier to the damage total.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Form
entries: Starting at 15th level, you grow a pair of wings that give you a flying speed of 30 feet. Your unarmed attacks also deal {@dice 1d6} + your strength modifier, and count as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Ascendancy
entries: At 20th level, you become so in-tune with your emulated dragon type that you begin the final process of becoming a true dragon. You gain the following benefits:

items: As an action, you can change your size to large. Whilst large, any damage with a weapon attack that you perform will roll an additional die worth of damage.
Your flying speed increases to 60 feet.
You gain immunity to your chosen damage type from your emulated dragon feature.
You gain a bite attack as a bonus action. This attack deals {@dice 1d10} + STR piercing damage.
You gain blindsight up to 60 feet.
When not wearing armour, you can add your charisma modifier to your AC.

entries: In addition, your lifespan extends to one-thousand years, unless it was longer.

subclassFeature.name: Wasterider
entries: In the vast expanses of sand, ash, and silt, there is no cover to be had nor shelter to be found. In places such as these, it isn't the capacity to hide amongst the sand that leads to survival, but rather the ability to traverse vast distances quickly and safety, and for that there are few things better than a mount.

Many can claim to have ridden the gruesome and alien beasts that roam the ravaged wastes, but as a Wasterider Ranger, you have formed a true bond with your mount and work with them to navigate the hellish wastelands you hail from.

subclassFeature.name: Mounted Tactics
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a level of understanding regarding how to protect your mount and use them in combat.

When mounted, if your mount is targeted by a weapon attack, you can use your reaction to attempt to deflect the blow. Roll a {@dice d10} and add your attack modifier; subtract this from the damage taken.
As part of a short rest, you can heal your mount a number of hit points equal to your Ranger level, in addition to any hit points regained as part of the short rest by expending hit die.

subclassFeature.name: Wasteland Mount
entries: At 3rd level, as part of a long rest, you can summon a friendly wasteland mount. You must have access either to a natural region or alternatively a location where mounts are kept. You choose between summoning a {@creature Bugcat Companion|BITCSubclasses|Bugcat} or a {@creature Spitlizard Companion|BITCSubclasses|Spitlizard}.
The mount is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands. See its game statistics in the accompanying mount stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places.

In combat, the mount shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the {@action Dodge} action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are {@condition incapacitated}, the mount can take any action of its choice, not just {@action Dodge}.
{@homebrew |When mounted, the mount counts as an {@homebrew controlled|independent} mount for the purposes of mounted combat.}

The mount remains until it is reduced to 0 hit points, until you use this feature to summon a mount again, or until you die. Anything the mount was wearing or carrying is left behind when the mount vanishes.
Once you summon the mount, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher to summon it.

subclassFeature.name: Helviti Manoeuvres
entries: At 7th level, you gain the following abilities, derived from tactics developed to survive and make the most of an animal bond in harsh environments:

entries.name: Ramming Speed
entries: When mounted, if your mount takes the {@action Dash} action whilst you are mounted on them and moves at least 20 ft., your next successful melee attack on that turn will do an additional amount of bludgeoning damage equal to your ranger level.

entries.name: Fang Ritual
entries: By expending a spell slot, you can grant your mount a bonus to melee attack damage equal to the level of the spell slot used for an hour. In addition, their melee attacks count as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance.

entries.name: Bonded
entries: When mounted, if you or your mount regains hit points, the other regains a number of hit points equal to your proficiency modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Brutal Companionship
entries: At 11th level, if you are below half of your hit point maximum, your mount gains a bonus to hit and to damage equal to half your ranger level, rounded up. In addition, if your mount is within 15 ft. of you, you gain advantage on death saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Killer Beastrider
entries: At 15th level, when you or your mount reduces a creature to 0 hit points or rolls a critical hit whilst you are mounted, you and your mount gain resistance to bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage until the end of your next turn and advantage on attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Copycat
entries: Not every rogue has the benefit of extensive training; some have to make do with learning on the fly, and to the Copycat rogue, being able to quickly imitate skills and abilities they observe and turn them against the ones who developed them is an art form they have perfected.

subclassFeature.name: Imitate Skill
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain the ability to quickly pick up new skills just by seeing someone else perform them, regardless of skill. Any time a creature you see performs an ability check, you can gain proficiency in that skill for one minute. If you already had proficiency in that skill, your proficiency bonus is doubled for the duration. This effect has no effect if you have expertise in the given skill or if your proficiency bonus was already doubled through other means.

subclassFeature.name: Pattern Fighter
entries: At 3rd level, when a creature hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to memorise their attack patterns and copy them. If you make an attack roll against that creature on your next turn, on a hit, you deal additional damage equal to the damage you took from the attack you copied.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Improviser
entries: At 9th level, you are able to copy the most basic forms of spells. When you see a creature cast a cantrip, you can on your next turn {@action cast a spell|PHB|cast} that cantrip as if you knew the spell without requiring material components.

subclassFeature.name: Beginners Luck
entries: At 13th level, not only are you adept at copying skills, but you are also able to improve on them to a degree. When you imitate a skill via the {@subclassFeature Imitate Skill|Rogue|PHB|Copycat|BITCSubclasses|3} ability, you also gain advantage on the next skill check you make that uses that skill.

subclassFeature.name: Skill Bandit
entries: At 17th level, you have the ability to, through carefully coordinated movements, undermine the ability of others to perform tasks they should be well trained at. When you deal damage with your {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|PHB|1} feature, you also impose a penalty to the creature's next attack roll, ability check, or save. This penalty is equal to your proficiency modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Origin
entries: Whether through a connection with nature, primal ritual linking your soul to bestial powers, or through lycanthropic ancestry, your magic is in tune with the beasts of this world, be they marvellous or malign. Your body is a vessel for primal, animalistic forces that you may either seek to control, or allow to run rampant.

subclassFeature.name: Animal Cunning
entries: You can add your charisma modifier to {@skill history}, {@skill arcana}, and {@skill religion} checks.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Claws
entries: Your unarmed attacks do {@damage 1d4} slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Magic
entries: Your link to your bestial side allows you to learn spells from the {@class Druid|PHB} class. When your spellcasting feature lets you learn or replace a sorcerer cantrip or a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose the new spell from the druid spell list or the sorcerer spell list. You must otherwise obey all the restrictions for selecting the spell, and it becomes a sorcerer spell for you.
In addition, know the spell {@spell Speak with Animals}, and it doesn't count against your number of sorcerer spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Harnessing the Beast
entries: Starting at 1st level, your bestial nature rises to the surface, but it also threatens to take over. At the end of a long rest, choose one of the following features, which lasts until the end of your next long rest.

In addition, whenever you take more than 5 + your Sorcerer level's worth of damage, you must make a charisma saving throw or else on your next turn make a melee attack against a random creature within 5 ft., or if this is not possible, move as far as your movement speed allows either towards or directly away from the source of the damage at random, as you either try to flee from harm or retaliate savagely against it. You will not move into obvious danger, such as fire, but this movement does trigger {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}. The DC for this save is equal to the damage taken (maximum 20). Upon {@homebrew passing|failing} the save, you will be immune to this effect until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Keen Senses
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill perception}. If you already had proficiency in {@skill perception}, your proficiency bonus is doubled, unless it was already doubled due to another feature such as expertise.

subclassFeature.name: Swift Movement
entries: Your {@homebrew walking|movement} speed increases by 10 ft.

subclassFeature.name: Thick Hide
entries: When not wearing armour, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity Modifier + your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Unnatural Movement
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to your {@homebrew walking|movement} speed.

subclassFeature.name: Venomous
entries: Once per round when you do damage with a spell or cantrip that targets a single creature, the target must succeed a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Revitalisation
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can spend 1 sorcery point to regain hit points equal to the spell level plus your charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Animal Feature
entries: Starting at 14th level, you manifest some physical trait of an animal linked to your sorcerous origin. Upon reaching level 14, select one of the following features. You can change which feature you have by expending 5 sorcery points as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Bovine Head
entries: Your head changes to that of a {@creature cow|VGM}, bull, or similar animal. You gain +2 to your Constitution score, and your maximum constitution is increased from 20 to 22. You can cast the spell {@spell Enhance Ability} thrice per long rest without expending a spell slot, using the Bull's Strength effect.

subclassFeature.name: Canine Snout
entries: A long muzzle grows to replace your nose and mouth. As a bonus action you can make a bite attack; this acts as an unarmed attack that deals {@damage 1d6} damage, plus your strength modifier. In addition, you gain advantage on all {@skill perception} checks made that rely on smell.

subclassFeature.name: Feathered Wings
entries: You manifest a pair of feathered wings on your back and gain a flying speed equal to your {@homebrew walking|movement} speed. You cannot wear armor unless the armor is made to {@homebrew accommodate|accomodate} them. You can cast the spell {@spell Fly} and {@spell Feather Fall} once each without using a spell slot per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Feline Legs
entries: Your entire lower half is replaced with legs reminiscent of a {@creature tiger}, {@creature panther}, cheetah, or other similar creature. You gain proficiency in {@skill acrobatics}. If you already had proficiency in {@skill acrobatics}, your proficiency bonus is doubled, unless it was already doubled from some other feature, such as expertise. Your jump distance and height is tripled.

subclassFeature.name: Raptor Talons
entries: Your hands and feet are replaced with long, razor-sharp talons. Your unarmed attacks deal {@damage 1d6} slashing damage, and you can use your dexterity modifier rather than your strength modifier, as if they were finesse weapons. In addition, you can make an additional attack when you take the {@action Attack} action, as per the {@classFeature Extra Attack|Fighter|PHB|5|PHB} feature.

subclassFeature.name: Scaled Body
entries: You grow thick scales across your body that help shield you from harm. At the end of a short rest, you gain temporary hit points equal to your sorcerer level. You can cast the spell {@spell Enlarge/Reduce} at will on yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Sorcerous Antlers
entries: You sprout a large crown of antlers on your head. These can serve as a {@filter spellcasting focus|items|source=|type=explosive device|category=|spellcasting focus=sorcerer}. You add the spell {@spell Commune with Nature} to your known spells list, and can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot, for as long as you have this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Natural Conduit
entries: At 18th level, you begin to act as a conduit for nature. When you expend one or more sorcery points, you can cause one of the following effects to occur:

subclassFeature.name: Infectious Savagery
entries: Choose a creature within 30 ft. of you. This creature will have a bonus to damage rolls equal to your charisma modifier until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Plant Growth
entries: The area within 20ft. of you becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for all creatures other than yourself. You also count as being heavily obscured. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Roar
entries: All creatures that can hear you within 30 ft. must make a wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition frightened} until the end of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Rejuvenation
entries: A number of creatures of your choosing you can see up to your charisma modifier regain {@dice 1d6} hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Hive Patron
entries: Your patron is connected to a powerful hive mind psychic entity that, either by forcibly affecting your judgement or through symbiotic agreement, uses you as an additional body in their complex and unfathomable connected organism.

Being connected to such a labyrinthine mind comes with advantages and disadvantages. Thoughts and visions flicker in your mind constantly, and it is a daily struggle to maintain your own mind in such conditions. However, the things you can learn and the sensations you experience are unlike anything any other creature can begin to comprehend.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you learn the {@spell message} and {@spell vicious mockery} cantrips. They count as warlock cantrips for you, but they don't count against your number of cantrips known.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Hive Mind lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Mind
entries: At 1st level, your mind is shared and able to move between different intelligent organisms. At the end of a short rest, you can choose a number of willing creatures up to your proficiency modifier. If willing, until the end of your next short rest, anything that the chosen creature can see and hear at any given time can be seen and heard by you, and when you cast a spell with a range of touch on the chosen creature, you do not need to be within touching range of your chosen creature and can instead cast it at any distance. Additionally, as an action, you can grant one of your chosen creatures a bonus on their next attack roll, save, or ability check that they can use before the beginning of your next turn. This bonus is equal to your charisma modifier and you can perform this action a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Dispersed Intellect
entries: At 6th level, you gain access to the collective intelligence of the hive mind. At the end of your short rest, select two skills; you gain proficiency in these skills until the end of your next short rest. If you already had proficiency in these skills, your proficiency bonus for these skills is doubled.

Once per short rest, you can tap into the hive mind for insight. As an action, you enter a communicative trance for one minute. During this time, you gain advantage on ability checks other than {@skill Perception} as the hive mind takes over your bodily functions and streamlines your thought processes for you; however due to the influx of information, you gain disadvantage on {@skill Perception} checks. This effect ends early if you take any form of damage.

subclassFeature.name: Complex Brain
entries: Starting at 10th level, you gain proficiency in intelligence saving throws. Additionally, once per round, the chosen creatures from your Shared Mind feature can gain a bonus to any intelligence, wisdom, or charisma saving throw equal to your charisma modifier.

If they pass the intelligence, wisdom, or charisma saving throw for which the bonus applied, they gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency modifier. These hit points disappear at the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Drone
entries: Starting at 14th level, as an action, you can issue a telepathic command to one of your chosen creatures subject to the {@subclassFeature Shared Mind|Warlock|PHB|Hive|BITCSubclasses|1} feature that isn't {@condition incapacitated}. The creature will immediately either make a weapon attack against a creature you choose that you can see, impose disadvantage on attack rolls against them, or move up to their full movement speed.
If they make a weapon attack as part of this command, they gain a bonus to the attack roll equal to your charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Dagger Wizard
entries: You focus on magic that draws and harnesses energy from the living; whether that might be yourself, or someone else. You use these energies to power your spells beyond what they could typically manage. To use this kind of magic without an external energy source will deplete your own life energy faster than before, but by using arcane sacrificial techniques, you can also replenish your health as you grow stronger by taking it from others as well.

Such wizards are often feared due to the wicked reputation such a focus garners them, but not all who follow this path are evil; some prefer to only draw energy from themselves or from willing volunteers. There are times when it is tactically advantageous to surrender a small degree of lifeforce to a wizard of this kind in exchange for a more potent spell, and those who travel with such wizards know it. Due to their tendency to draw power via cuts, they are known by most who see them at work as 'dagger wizards'.

subclassFeature.name: Harness Lifeforce
entries: Beginning at 2nd level, you can use your own lifeforce to power a spell you cast. When you {@action cast a spell} that deals damage, you can reroll a number of dice up to your intelligence modifier for one damage roll per turn. You must use the new rolls. You must then take damage equal to the number of dice rerolled. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

Alternatively, when you {@action cast a spell} that requires a saving throw, you can impose a penalty to one saving throw per turn equal to your intelligence modifier. You must then take the same damage. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

activation.condition: When you cast a spell that deals damage or requires a saving throw

subclassFeature.name: Sacrificial Syphon
entries: At 6th level, you are able to siphon back the power you lost through sacrifice, willing or otherwise. As a bonus action, you can make a single melee attack with a weapon you are proficient with using your spellcasting modifier to hit and deal damage. You regain half the damage dealt as health.
You are able to perform this act a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier, and regain all expended uses after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Power
entries: At 10th level, you are able to regain magical power by sacrificing your life energy. As a bonus action, you can sacrifice hit points in exchange for spell slots up to level 3. The amount of hit points sacrificed is equal to the level of the spell times 3.

subclassFeature.name: Infinite Engine
entries: At 14th level, once per turn when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points using a spell of 1st level or higher, you regain hit points equal to the level of the spell times 5.

monster.name: Bugcat Companion

languages: can understand the Ranger but can't speak

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The Bugcat has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Bugcat's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the Bugcat moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 10 + PB} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the Bugcat can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Running Leap
entries: With a 10-foot running start, the Bugcat can long jump up to 25 ft.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The Bugcat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

entries: A creature that hits the Spitlizard with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed a {@dc 10 + PB} Constitution save or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next round.

table.name: Destined Strike Table
rows: You roll each damage die for this attack twice, as for an ordinary critical hit.
The subject of the attack becomes {@condition frightened} of you until the start of your next turn.
You regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt.
You can target a creature within 30ft. of you to suffer the damage dealt again. This creature cannot be the target of the first attack.
You have advantage on all further attacks against the creature until the start of your next turn.
The creature's movement speed is halved until the end of your next turn.
You may make another attack roll.

table.name: Hive Patron Extended Spells List
rows: {@spell Speak with Dead}, {@spell Speak With Plants}

table.name: Reality Warp
rows: You switch places with a creature you see within 60 ft. of you. This does not provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

Choose a creature you can see within 60 ft. of you. This creature gains advantage on attack rolls until the beginning of your next turn. Attacks against this creature have advantage until the beginning of your next turn.
You gain a flying speed of 30ft until the end of your next turn.
You become {@condition invisible} until the end of your next turn.
You vanish until the end of your next turn.

You choose a creature you can see within 60 ft. of you. This creature can can use its reaction to take an action at the end of your turn. On the start of its next turn, can only take an action or a bonus action.

table.name: Reason Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Detect Thoughts|PHB}, {@spell Nystul's Magic Aura|PHB|Arcanist's Magic Aura}

table.name: Unnatural Alteration Table
rows: The creature's attacks do an additional {@damage 1d10} force damage
The creature grows a pair of misshapen wings and gains a flying speed of 60ft.
The creature gains resistance to piercing, slashing, and bludgeoning damage.

The creature grows a third arm. They can now make an additional attack when taking the {@action Attack} action. This attack can either be an unarmed strike, or a weapon attack should the creature be capable of equipping a weapon.
At the end of their turn, they can choose to switch places with a willing creature within 30ft. of them.
The creature can fire beams of light from their eyes. They can make a ranged attack at a creature within 120 ft. using their Wisdom modifier that deals {@damage 2d6} radiant damage as an action.
